result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A. KOEPPLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon]. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark A. KOEPPLER

defendant.name: KOEPPLER, Mark A.
defendant.address: 634 Steiners Corner Road, Two Rivers, WI 54241

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
The State moves to amend to county ordinance disorderly conduct, contrary to Manitowoc County Ordinance 6.19.  Motion granted.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the amended charge. Convicted.  Further, the State moves to dismiss and read in count 2 as part of the plea agreement.
The Court imposes a $50.00 forfeiture plus costs, total of $267.50. This balance is to be paid by 12/22/2015 or 5 dats county jail for failure ro pay.
Reminder notice mailed to defendant.

Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.   Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 10-16-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Plea date is set for 12-18-15 at 11:00 a.m.  Defendant's correct spelling of his last name is Koeppler.   Court directs the record to be corrected.      
Mintues.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of disorderly conduct/use of dangerous weapon and endanger safety by use of dangerous weapon.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 09-14-15 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he have no contact with Kari Brouchoud, maintain absolute sobriety and not possess any firearms.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
